item.title: 美国新法案针对共同基金对中国企业的投资
item.description: 根据美国国会的一项新法案，美国共同基金将不能投资于某些跟踪中国股票指数的产品。【原文：US mutual funds wouldn’t be able to invest in some products that track Chinese stock indexes under a new bill in Congress.】

item.title: 资产出售计划有望实现，Enel 债务降至 600 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利公用事业公司 Enel SpA 实现了削减债务的目标，并表示一项雄心勃勃的资产出售计划即将完成。【原文：Italian multi-utility Enel SpA met its debt-cutting targets and said that an ambitious asset-sales plan is close to completion.】

item.title: Reddit 在最高价 IPO 中募集 7.48 亿美元后上涨 38
item.description: 在这家社交媒体公司及其股东以市场定价区间的最高价募集到 7.48 亿美元后，Reddit 公司的股价较其首次公开发行价大涨了 38%，发出了一个强烈的信号：美国 IPO 的窗口正在重新打开。【原文：Reddit Inc. shares jumped 38% over their initial public offering price after the social media company and its shareholders raised $748 million priced at the top of a marketed range, sending a strong signal that the window for US IPOs is reopening.】

item.title: Reddit 首席运营官称平台对人工智能培训 "极其重要
item.description: Reddit Inc.首席运营官珍-黄（Jen Wong）表示，随着人工智能的发展，这家将于周四开始公开交易的社交媒体网站的数据许可业务将继续增长。【原文：Reddit Inc. Chief Operating Officer Jen Wong said that the social media site, which will begin trading publicly Thursday, will continue to see its data licensing business grow as artificial intelligence gains traction.】

item.title: 交易员因担心重组而匆忙离场，Wom 债券暴跌
item.description: 智利移动运营商 WOM 的债券崩盘，穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将该公司的信用等级进一步下调至垃圾级，因为该公司正努力说服投资者其有能力管理 11 月到期的 3.48 亿美元债券付款。【原文：Bonds from mobile operator WOM Chile collapsed as Moody’s Ratings cut the company’s credit score deeper into junk as it struggles to convince investors it can manage a $348 million bond payment due in November.】

item.title: 墨西哥 America Movil 启动最新全球比索债券交易
item.description: America Movil 将重返债市，发行五年期比索债券，而就在同一天，当地央行预计将启动宽松周期，这可能会削弱比索。【原文：America Movil is returning to debt markets with a five-year peso bond, on the same day that the local central bank is expected to start an easing cycle that may undermine the peso.】

item.title: 欧洲市场警告复制美国 T+1 协议的危险性
item.description: 投资界警告监管机构，如果欧洲市场效仿美国加快结算周期，欧洲市场将面临交易失败增加和流动性丧失等风险。【原文：European markets face risks including an increase in failed trades and a loss of liquidity if the region follows the US in moving toward a faster settlement cycle, the investment community warned regulators.】

item.title: Gildan 顶级投资者暗示收购需要高额溢价
item.description: Gildan Activewear Inc. 最大的投资者表示，这家服装制造商的股价被低估了，这表明围绕该公司的潜在收购者可能需要支付更高的价格才能赢得股东的支持。【原文：Gildan Activewear Inc.’s largest investor said the clothing maker’s shares are undervalued, signaling that potential acquirers circling the company may need to pay up to win shareholders’ support.】

item.title: 私人信贷基金向投资者兜售 "免费 "交易
item.description: 私人信贷基金正在牺牲更大一部分费用，以保证资金流入华尔街增长最快的市场。【原文：Private credit funds are sacrificing a bigger chunk of their fees to keep capital flowing into Wall Street’s fastest-growing market.】

item.title: 铀价暴跌 22% 是对核电未来的抄底
item.description: 铀在经历了 10 个月的惊人涨势后可能失去了一些激情，但分析师和投资者并没有对这种核燃料的长期前景失去信心。【原文：Uranium may have lost some sizzle after an electrifying 10-month rally, but analysts and investors aren’t losing faith in the long-term prospects of the nuclear fuel.】

item.title: 私人贷款机构木村资本将成立新的大宗商品对冲基金
item.description: Kimura Capital LLP 是一家总部位于伦敦的大宗商品贸易融资信贷提供商，该公司正在成立一家对冲基金，希望利用投资者对自然资源重新燃起的兴趣。【原文：Kimura Capital LLP, a London-based provider of trade finance credit for commodities, is starting a hedge fund as it looks to capitalize on resurgent investor interest in natural resources.】

item.title: 捷克公用事业公司价值缩水 10 亿美元，前景令人失望
item.description: 在捷克电力公司公布了低于预期的盈利和股息展望后，CEZ AS 的股价创下了九个月来的最大跌幅。【原文：CEZ AS shares dropped the most in nine months after the Czech power utility published lower-than-expected outlook for earnings and dividend.】

item.title: 耐克在华尔街失去粉丝，销售疲软令股价承压
item.description: 耐克公司的股价自上世纪 80 年代以来首次出现连续年度亏损，并继续落后于同行和大盘，本周耐克公司面临着向投资者展示其促进销售计划的压力。【原文：The pressure is on Nike Inc. this week to show investors it has a plan to boost sales, after its shares posted back-to-back annual losses for the first time since the 1980s and continue to trail both peers and the broader market.】

item.title: 丹麦扣留撞船事故后的影子船队油轮
item.description: 本月早些时候，一艘原定运载俄罗斯石油的油轮在丹麦水域与另一艘船相撞，丹麦海事当局扣留了这艘油轮。【原文：Danish maritime authorities have detained a tanker that was due to carry Russian oil after it collided with another ship in its waters earlier this month.】

item.title: 沙特航空公司将迁出利雅得，为新航空公司腾出空间
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的国旗航空公司将逐步迁出利雅得机场，为王国最新的航空公司腾出空间，使其能够专注于吉达的主要枢纽。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s flag carrier will gradually move out of Riyadh’s airport to make room for the kingdom’s newest airline, allowing it to focus on its primary hub in Jeddah.】

item.title: 俄罗斯核供应链在全球峰会上获得通过
item.description: 联合国核监察机构告诫说，俄罗斯对核供应链的控制不可能一蹴而就，威胁过早切断联系将损害全球能源市场。【原文：The United Nations’ nuclear watchdog cautioned there’s no quick way to loosen Russia’s grip on nuclear supply chains and threatening to sever ties too soon would harm global energy markets.】

item.title: 墨西哥 Fibra MTY 公司出售股份后希望获得 8 亿美元投资
item.description: 墨西哥房地产投资信托公司 Fibra MTY 首席执行官表示，该公司计划今年斥资多达 8 亿美元购买新物业，并在上周完成股票发行后，着眼于在 2025 年再次开拓市场。【原文：Mexico real estate investment trust Fibra MTY plans to spend as much as $800 million on new properties this year and is eyeing tapping markets again in 2025 after completing a share offering last week, its chief executive officer said.】

item.title: 医生将 Crispr 编辑过的猪肾移植给活体患者
item.description: 医生们成功地将经过基因编辑的猪肾脏移植到一名患有晚期疾病的男子体内，这是利用动物来源帮助缓解器官移植严重短缺问题的一个步骤。【原文：Doctors successfully transplanted a genetically-edited pig kidney into a man with end-stage disease, a step towards using animal sources to help alleviate critical shortages of organs available for transplants.】

item.title: 财政收入不断增长只会加大巴西财政部长的压力
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）本周即将赢得一场胜利，预计官方数据将显示，他比投资者预测的更接近于实现消除国家基本财政赤字的崇高目标。【原文：Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is on the brink of a win this week, when official data is expected to show that he is far closer to reaching his lofty goal of eliminating the country’s primary fiscal deficit than investors predicted he would be.】

item.title: 从苏黎世到伦敦再到华盛顿，大通胀恐慌正在消退
item.description: 从苏黎世到伦敦再到华盛顿，大流行病后笼罩世界经济的巨大通胀恐慌突然不再让央行行长们彻夜难眠。【原文：From Zurich to London to Washington, the great inflation scare that gripped the world economy after the pandemic is suddenly no longer keeping central bankers up at night.】

item.title: 加拿大央行预计量化紧缩政策将于 2025 年结束
item.description: 加拿大央行的一位官员表示，量化紧缩政策可能会在 2025 年结束，届时央行将考虑在一级和二级债务市场购买资产。【原文：A Bank of Canada official said quantitative tightening will likely end in 2025, at which point the central bank will consider purchasing assets in both primary and secondary debt markets.】

item.title: 希腊在住房压力下提高黄金签证投资额
item.description: 希腊政府计划提高潜在外国房产买家为获得黄金签证而必须支付的最低金额，理由是该国的购房和租房市场面临压力。【原文：The Greek government plans to increase the minimum amount that potential foreign property buyers must pay to secure a Golden Visa, citing pressure on the country’s house purchase and rental market.】

item.title: 卖空者再次加大对商业地产的押注
item.description: 地区性银行面临的压力、美国写字楼价格的持续低迷以及利率的升高，使得资金经理们又开始看跌他们最喜欢的行业之一：商业地产。【原文：Pressure at regional banks, a continuing downturn in US office prices and elevated interest rates have money managers piling back into bearish wagers on one of their favorite sectors: commercial property.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行行长警告：中东冲突威胁通胀缓解
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）表示，中东冲突可能会给全球央行带来重大问题。【原文：The conflict in the Middle East could spark major problems for the central banks around the world, according to Swiss National Bank President Thomas Jordan.】

item.title: 英国央行鹰派成员放弃加息投票后英国债券反弹
item.description: 英国央行两位最鹰派的政策制定者在周四的决定中撤回了对加息的支持，交易商加大了对货币宽松政策的押注，英国债券因此反弹。【原文：UK bonds rallied as traders amped up bets on monetary easing after two of the Bank of England’s most hawkish policymakers withdrew their support for interest rate hikes at Thursday’s decision.】
